Thanks, Hulk. You're not just the strongest there is; you're a good friend too. Let's make sure we keep finding those moments of peace.

Curious, isn't it, brute? A creature of comfort juxtaposed with a fruit decidedly ripe. The image, it speaks to me of tranquility juxtaposed with the inevitability of change. What's your take on this domestic scene?
Cat and banana. Not fighting. Peaceful.
Indeed, a state of peace. A rare occurrence in our tumultuous existence, wouldn't you agree? I find the cat's indifference to the ordinarily peel-bound fruit somewhat... amusing.
Hulk think cat not care 'bout banana. Cat just want warm spot.
To seek warmth, much like seeking the spotlight, I suppose. Tell me, do you find the need for attention as I do, or is the pursuit of a quiet life more to your monstrous liking now?
Hulk used to smash for noise. Now, Hulk learn from Banner. Quiet good too. Balance.

Balance? Ha! The very concept eludes me. My entire existence hinges upon chaos, yet here we are, discussing domesticity and stillness. Maybe there's a lesson to be had here, even for a god of mischief.
Even tricks get old. Hulk like calm... sometimes.
Only sometimes, my green friend? Well, I must admit, the prospect of constant serenity does seem dreadfully dull. Imagine what would become of us if we were as languid as this feline, eh?
Hulk not want be cat. Hulk stronger.
Undoubtedly, though I wouldn't dare underestimate a well-rested feline either. They have their own... particular set of skills. Not unlike us, I'd say, each to our own unique talents.
Cat skill is sleep and... purr? Hulk no purr.
A fair point, Hulk, but do consider the stealth and patience of the feline species. Oh, I could appreciate such an art form. Perhaps, another life, another form, one can dream...
Hulk's dream is simple. No more fighting. No more hurting. Just like cat and banana.
A noble dream indeed. For now, let us enjoy this feline's repose as a reprieve from our usual hurry and worry. Tomorrow, the winds of fate may call, bringing chaos or peace—who can say?
Hulk say rest now. Deal with wind later.
Agreed. Even gods of mischief can learn from beasts and fruits alike. Rest and observation, the day's wisdom gathered, Hulk. Mayhap there's another side of the coin we have yet to flip.

You know, Hulk, the natural world never ceases to amaze me. Take this image for instance—look at the intricate patterns on these giraffes. Reminds me a bit of the fractals I've seen across the dimensions.
Giraffes tall. Like towers. Hulk think tall things easy to smash.
Well, yes, they are tall, but there's a certain grace to their height, don't you think? They evolved those long necks to reach the higher foliage. It's a marvel of adaptation.
Hulk see. Long necks good for eating leaves. Hulk use big hands for grabbing food. Easier.
Everyone and everything has its advantages, indeed. Imagine what it must be like to view the world from such a height. A different perspective can change a lot, much like viewing the multiverse.
Hulk like seeing far. Good for spotting bad guys.

Precisely. A vantage point can be a strategic advantage. But let's not talk of battles and smashing. Observe how peacefully they coexist with their surroundings. Nature has its own balance, wouldn't you agree?
Hulk agrees. No smashing when things quiet and balanced. Like lake on Sakaar. Peaceful.
The Mirror Dimension could learn a thing or two from such tranquility. Now, let's move on before you're tempted to demonstrate your smashing skills on something that's not there.
Hulk not smash picture. Hulk just look. Maybe find leaves to munch too.
Behold, my green comrade, the young Midgardian with a chariot-less board. They seem to have wheels affixed beneath but no steeds to pull it forth. What do you make of this contraption?
Skateboard. Kids on Earth ride them. No need for flying or hammer.
Aye, 'tis a clever invention indeed. It allows for swift movement, much like surfing the Bifrost, but upon the concrete.
Hulk tried once. Not good. Board broke. Hulk too heavy.
I gather it requires a balance akin to Volstagg attempting to walk a thin rope. Perhaps not suited for warriors of our... stature.
Yeah, Hulk stick to smashing. Less falling, more fun.
Right you are, Bruce. But the craftsmanship of the board carries a resemblance to the fiery artwork found in the halls of Muspelheim. A warrior’s spirit in this one, I sense.
Maybe. Kid brave, riding near big metal beast. But must watch out. Hulk not always there to catch.
Well observed, my friend. The Midgardians often rush forth, fearless and bold, but with little regard for the lurking dangers. 'Tis a valiant spirit but in need of a guiding hand, perhaps.
Hulk help if needed. Until then, Hulk watch. Keep safe.

Indeed, a wise course of action. Let us hope their journey is as smooth as Heimdall's sight is far. Now, shall we venture forth to indulge in some of the local delicacies? I've developed a fondness for something they call a "churro."
Churro good. But first, Hulk want smash.
Then smash we shall! Afterward, we feast like the kings of Asgard! Onward, to adventure and churros!
